job description:
Process Scientist I/ II

(Req : 8308296)

Fremont, CA

One year contract, with likely extension

$25-35/hr DOE

Duties:

The candidate will contribute strong analytical skills, attention to detail, and the ability to deliver results in a fast-paced working environment.

Candidate will be expected to perform a variety of analytical techniques in support of process development studies.

Relevant techniques are UV/Vis, amino acid analysis by HPLC, affinity assays by HPLC, purity by capillary electrophoresis CE or LabChip , size exclusion chromatography by HPLC and charge variants by cation exchange chromatography.

Other potential techniques are immuno-based assays for binding and impurity analysis ELISA, Octet, Biacore, as well as qPCR.

Other duties include:

-Initiate and complete scientific experiments

-Independently execute test methods

-Analyze and critically review analytical data

-Present analytical results in a clear manner

-Perform basic troubleshooting for technical problems

Education:

Bachelors or Master’s Degree in Chemistry, Biology, or a related field

Experience:

- Hands-on experience in protein analytics, with experience in 1 or 2 of the above described analytical assays

- Excellent written and oral communication skills

- Ability to work in a team environment

- BS with 4+ years in protein analytics, MS with 2+ years of experience

Please apply now for immediate consideration!
